Squats

Squats are a fundamental lower-body exercise that engage multiple muscle groups, including the quadriceps, hamstrings, glutes, and calves. By mimicking a natural sitting motion, squats help to improve mobility and build functional strength that translates to everyday activities. In addition to building muscle, squats can enhance balance and coordination. They are also an excellent exercise for boosting the metabolism, as they activate large muscle groups, which leads to greater calorie burn. Incorporating squats into your workout routine will not only strengthen your legs but also improve overall athletic performance.
